title: Club bouncer, 48, knocked to the ground and kicked in Liverpool city centre as police launch appeal
text:
A nightclub bouncer was knocked to the ground and kicked by a reveller as police launch an appeal to track the assailant down.

The attack was caught on camera by an onlooker outside the side door of McCooley's club in Concert Square, Liverpool.

In the footage a group of men have gathered on the street as one clubber, dressed in blue jeans and a black t-shirt, attempts to kick the doorman.

The young man grapples with the security guard before briefly stumbling backwards as the security man defends himself.

The reveller then launches a furious attack of punches on the member of security staff.

He is briefly held back by one of his friends who is standing behind him but soon wrestles free.

A nightclub bouncer was knocked to the ground and repeatedly kicked by a reveller as police launch an appeal to track him down

The attack was caught on camera by an onlooker outside the side door of McCooley's club in Concert Square, Liverpool, on September 21

He then manages to pull the bouncer on to the road and throws him to the ground before taking a running kick at the doorman before he runs out of shot.

The doorman is left lying on his back on the cobbles as onlookers continue to look on and shout.

One of the witnesses goes over to the staff member and tries to put him in the recovery position, which is where the video ends.

The reveller then manages to pull the bouncer on to the road and throws him to the ground before taking a running kick at the doorman

One of the witnesses goes over to the staff member and tries to help him by putting him in the recovery position, which is where the video ends

The phone footage was taken shortly before 2am on Saturday, September 21 and police are now appealing for information to find the person responsible.

Officers have released a number of CCTV images of a man they believe could help them in their investigation.

A spokesperson for Merseyside Police said: 'We have issued CCTV stills of a man who may be able to assist an investigation into an assault on a member of door staff in Liverpool city centre last month.

'It was reported the 48-year-old man was punched and pulled to the floor before being kicked close to McCooley's bar at about 1.55am on Saturday, September 21 2019.'

Officers have released a number of CCTV images of a man they believe could help them in their investigation

Detective Inspector Jennie Beck said: 'This was a vicious assault on the doorman who was simply trying to do his job.

'Nobody should be subjected to this level of violence when they are just trying to earn a living.

'We believe the offender was ejected from McCooley's club shortly before the incident and appeal to anyone who may have witnessed any part of the incident or know who was responsible to contact police.

'If you recognise the man pictured, please get in touch as we believe he may have information that could prove to be a vital part of our enquires.'
description: The attack was caught on camera by an onlooker outside McCooley's club in Concert Square, Liverpool.The reveller grapples with the bouncer before launching a furious attack.
